title: How to File Taxes
subtitle: Step-by-step guide for the Capital Region
estimated_time: 5 minutes to learn, 30 minutes to file

sections.title: Gather Your Documents
sections.content:
Before you start, collect:

✓ W-2 form (from your employer) - arrives in January
✓ Social Security Number
✓ Bank account info (for direct deposit refund)

If you did gig work (DoorDash, Uber, freelance):
✓ 1099 forms (companies send if you made $600+)

sections.title: Choose Your Free Filing Method
sections.content:
For Capital Region youth making under $73,000:

IRS Free File (100% free)
→ irs.gov/freefile
→ Works for simple tax situations

Cash App Taxes (free, mobile-friendly)
→ cash.app/taxes
→ Great for W-2 only filers

VITA Tax Help (free in-person help)
→ Location: 90 State Street, Albany
→ Phone: (518) 434-4582
→ Open Feb–April, walk-ins welcome
→ Bring: W-2, ID, Social Security card

sections.title: Enter Your Information
sections.content:
The software walks you through four simple sections:

1. Personal Information
- Name, address, Social Security Number
- Filing status (usually "Single")

2. Income
- Enter numbers from your W-2 Box 1
- The software does the math

3. Deductions
- Most youth take the Standard Deduction ($13,850)
- Select "Standard" and continue

4. Credits
- Software checks eligibility automatically
- Earned Income Credit if you made under $17k
- Education credits if you are in college

sections.title: Review and Submit
sections.content:
Before you file:
✓ Double-check your Social Security Number
✓ Verify your bank account for refund
✓ Confirm income matches your W-2

Then click "E-File".

What happens next:
• Confirmation email within 24 hours
• Refund in 2–3 weeks (if owed)
• No further action required until next year

local_resources.name: Albany Public Library
local_resources.description: Free computer access and tax forms
local_resources.notes: Staff cannot give tax advice but can help locate resources

key_takeaways: Filing is free if you make under $73,000 — never pay for tax software
The IRS already receives your income information from your W-2
Penalties increase if you do not file on time, even if you cannot pay
Most first-time workers receive refunds, not tax bills
Local, free help is available through VITA in Albany
next_steps: Save this guide for next tax season
Set a phone reminder for January 31 to look for your W-2
If you owe money and cannot pay, file anyway and set up a payment plan
Visit SEFCU for free financial counseling if needed
